dcterms:creator: Y. LeCun
dcterms:description: The MNIST dataset consists of 60,000 training images and 10,000 test images of handwritten digits, each image being 28x28 pixels. The dataset is used for training and evaluating machine learning models, particularly in the context of digit recognition.
dcterms:title: MNIST

dcterms:creator: H. Xiao
K. Rasul
R. Vollgraf
dcterms:description: Fashion MNIST is a dataset consisting of 70,000 grayscale images of fashion products, with 60,000 images for training and 10,000 for testing. Each image is 28x28 pixels and belongs to one of 10 categories, making it a more challenging alternative to the MNIST dataset.
dcterms:title: Fashion MNIST (FMNIST)

dcterms:creator: A. Krizhevsky
G. Hinton
dcterms:description: CIFAR-10 is a dataset containing 60,000 32x32 color images in 10 different classes, with 6,000 images per class. It is commonly used for training machine learning models in image classification tasks.
dcterms:title: CIFAR-10

dcterms:creator: A. Krizhevsky
G. Hinton
dcterms:description: CIFAR-100 is similar to CIFAR-10 but contains 100 classes with 600 images each. It is used for more fine-grained image classification tasks.
dcterms:title: CIFAR-100
